result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua D Kerr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine is to be paid at the rate of $25 per month commencing 07-01-2017 or serve 6 days jail as penalty for failure to pay fine.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Wolff.

Defendant Joshua D Kerr in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant completed counseling and treatment.  State moves to have count 1 dismissed and read-in, Court grants the State's motion.
Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances (penalty enhancer statute to remain).  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  
Court orders the following:
$430.50 to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing July 1, 2017 or 6 days jail for penalty for non payment of fine.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim/witness listed in criminal complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.
